item.title: NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Program Information session - March 5
item.description: Wednesday, March 5, 2025 12:00 AM - 1:00 AM - The NSF GRFP provides 3 years of salary and tuition for Masters and PhD students in 30+ STEM fields. Rensselaer students earn this prestigious award every year. Seniors, 1st and 2nd year grad students (fall 2025) who are U.S. citizens or permanent residents are eligible. Email madige@rpi.edu for information or Register for the virtual session.

item.title: Leaders in Action Conversation with Provost Rebecca Doerge - February 27
item.description: Thursday, February 27, 2025 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - A conversation with Provost Rebecca Doerge on “Life Lessons: Decisions and the Path in Front of You”. Presented by the department of Industrial Systems and Engineering and Professor Azita Hirsa. Refreshments will be served.

item.title: Department of Transportation Info Session to be held March 11
item.description: The New York State Department of Transportation will be on campus for an info session on Tuesday, March 11th from 5:30-6:30pm. A representative will discuss working for the company, available opportunities, and more. Learn more about this event and register in Handshake!

item.title: The McKinney Student Writing Contest Is Now Open!
item.description: The 2025 McKinney Writing Contest is open, and both undergraduate and graduate students are invited to submit entries in a wide range of categories to win cash prizes! Entries are due by midnight on March 11, 2025. Please see the McKinney Writing Contest page for more information, or email the contest committee if you have questions.

item.title: Mercer X Staff Hours and Staff Skills Schedule
item.description: The Spring 2025 Mercer XLab is open 8 a.m.- 8 p.m. on weekdays. The Mercer XLab Staff schedule includes the names with their associated skills to help you during work hours. Visit https://mercerxlab.rpi.edu/lab-access-and-resources and click on “Spring 2025 Schedule (Created by Notion)” to find the staff with the skills you need to help you succeed!

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: Supervisory Essentials
item.description:
In this seminar, Managers and Supervisors will learn from each other and our Facilitators about important topics such as the Employee Value Proposition and Employee Experience, the six fundamental Leadership competencies at Rensselaer, and experience several “Supervisory Simulations” with colleagues. In addition, the importance of coaching employee performance, providing both rewards and recognition, employment law fundamentals and tools for building team capacity will be explored.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
